item.title: DC Sports Bog: Pregame music at FedEx Field perfectly encapsulates Redskins’ QB situation
item.description:
This is silly, somewhat amusing and, in the midst of another 10-loss season, #SoRedskins.

Before Washington’s 24-0 loss to the Rams on Sunday, the Redskins’ official Twitter account posted a Vine of Colt McCoy taking warmup snaps at FedEx Field.

item.dc:creator: Scott Allen
item.ExtractedText: By Scott Allen December 10 at 10:11 AM Follow @ScottSAllen (Photo by Patrick Smith/Getty Images) This is silly, somewhat amusing and, in the midst of another 10-loss season, #SoRedskins. Before Washington’s 24-0 loss to the Rams on Sunday, the Redskins’ official Twitter account posted a Vine of Colt McCoy taking warmup snaps at FedEx Field. — Washington Redskins (@Redskins) December 7, 2014 Music blared in the background and at least one fan recognized it as a jam by the Arlington-based reggae band SOJA . — Justin Thorn (@ThornyPlush) December 7, 2014 The song is “I Believe” off SOJA’s Grammy-nominated 2014 album Amid the Noise and Haste and a friend of the band called our attention to the lyrics that can be heard during first part of the six-second clip: “Or sit down and wait for your turn.” Did Robert Griffin III shoot this Vine? Or the Illuminati? Silly, but so Redskins. Scott Allen writes about all things D.C. sports. Follow him on Twitter @ScottSAllen or e-mail him if you’ve got a tip to share.
